body: LGTM
LGTM
Can you add a test please?
@hamedhsn, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @r39132, @mistercrunch and @jasonjho to be potential reviewers.
Looks good to everybody ?
@bolkedebruin, could you please merge? :)
CI failed on test_trigger_dag_for_date, which is reported as AIRFLOW-1245. It's irrelevant to this fix since CI failed only on Python 2.7 x PostgreSQL backend.
LGTM, love the test on `test_spark_process_on_kill`.
Can you please add tests and correct the typo in your commit message?
@mremes please don't forget the tests: it is the reason why it was not caught in the first place.
@bolkedebruin, what about this one? :)
@bolkedebruin, will add. Thanks.

I had also noticed that Pools could be created with empty size.. I think that is a bug not a feature, though some people mentioned it's good to have another way to "pause dags". I think it would be nice to have an alert pop up to let someone know when they are creating an empty pool.

@bolkedebruin added tests for upstream and depends_on_past dependencies not met. Run the scenario locally as I don't have the dev environment setup for running the tests yet... Will probably need to as there's more to contribute

I've added a reply to our previous [discussion](https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2292#discussion_r118976649).

Besides that fix everything looks good to me! :)
Is this being taken a look at? We are thinking about implementing the same feature. Would love the airflow team to review.
I modified those tests in a subsequent PR to only run when a specific switch is set.
@r39132, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @jasonjho and @criccomini to be potential reviewers.

@ilopezfr : https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2332/commits/fbe4fb7a92ba2f788b70d4bb9482d509c2fe41a4

I went ahead and made the change. Please follow this in the future.
I don't like that it decreases the coverage. How come?
@bolkedebruin , can you please review this, i have removed ssh test from core test as well. Thanks
@forsberg, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @bolkedebruin, @mistercrunch and @dhuang to be potential reviewers.
And apparently there are no longer any landscape builds, so now I'm lost into what needs to be fixed? :-(
@zoyahav, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @criccomini, @mistercrunch and @mtagle to be potential reviewers.

> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

Hi @bolkedebruin, have correct the commit message and added specs. but somehow Travis is failing and having some setup issues? Can you suggest how I can fix it, in case you've seen the issue before?
Rebased to master again.
CI failure seems to be caused by environmental problem. That has started from [build #6396](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/builds/238163269).
@alexvanboxel @criccomini can you please have a look?
Please verify the build error
Can you squash your commits and provide a proper description in the commit message?

It's time to step back in the game. I've been so busy the last month. I'll
reserve some time to go over some PR.

wrote:

This won't work quite as is - the default value is not valid json:

> json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)

so the default should be `{}`, and because this default template is passed to string.format it should be:

```ini
broker_transport_options = {{}}
```

please retrigger the build by an empty commit.
It seems that if clear_dagrun can be part of clear, dag_success could be part of success
And maybe it should be dagrun_success

@saguziel I think dagrun/task clearing should be separate functions, having them in the same function is the equivalent to having 15 different classes and then having a function that switches off of the class type, instead of just having 15 different functions to call in the first place.
@aoen That is a pattern though. We save some code duplication, and we don't have 15 classes. Especially since we aren't actually clearing the dag_run, but rather the tasks that belong to it.
Spoke with @saguziel offline, we are in agreement that dagrun/task clearing should be separate functions that call some common functions.
